sen.j: 稚狭王（わかさのおおきみ、生年不明 - 天武天皇7年（678年）9月）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Wakasa no Okimi (year of birth unknown -September 678) was a person who lived during the Asuka period.
Wakasa no Okimi (year of birth unknown - September 678) was a person who lived during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Wakasa no Okimi (year of birth unknown - September 678) was a person who lived during the Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「わかさのおほきみ」。
sen.e: His name is pronounced in the old Japanese syllabary characters as follows: 'Wakasa no Ohokimi.
His name is read in the old Japanese syllabary characters as 'Wakasa no Ohokimi.'
sen.cmt: pronounced→read,as follows→as,スペース、クォーツをを修正しました。セミコロンを削除しました。
sen.e: His name is read in the old Japanese syllabary characters as 'Wakasa no Ohokimi.'
He was an Imperial family member, but his family tree was unknown.
He was an Imperial Ffamily member, but his family tree is unknown.
sen.cmt: Imperial family→Imperial Family,was→is と修正しました。
sen.e: He was an Imperial Ffamily member, but his family tree is unknown.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき倭京にいて、大伴吹負の指揮権奪取に遭い、大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従った。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War took place in 672, Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato, and went over to the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) after OTOMO no Fukei took control of the City of Yamato.

When the Jinshin War took place in 672, Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato, and went over to the side of the Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) after OTOMO no Fukei took control of the City of Yamato.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War took place in 672, Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato, and went over to the side of the Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) after OTOMO no Fukei took control of the City of Yamato.
He received Sanmi (Third Rank)
His Court Rank was Sanmi (Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 意味を通りやすくするためCourt Rank を補い、修正しました。 ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: His Court Rank was Sanmi (Third Rank).

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）6月に大海人皇子が挙兵すると、大友皇子（弘文天皇）は倭京（飛鳥の古い都）の留守司高坂王に軍を編成させた。
sen.e: When Prince Oama waged war against Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) in June 672, Prince Otomo ordered Takasaka no Okimi, the governor of the City of Yamato (the old capital in Asuka), to raise an army.

When the Prince Oama waged war against the Prince Otomo (the Emperor Kobun) in June 672, the Prince Otomo ordered Takasaka no Okimi, the officer to guard the City of Yamato (the old capital in Asuka) while the master was away, to raise an army.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。「留守司」＝「留守官」であることからこの部分を officer to guard while the master was away とし、修正しました。
sen.e: When the Prince Oama waged war against the Prince Otomo (the Emperor Kobun) in June 672, the Prince Otomo ordered Takasaka no Okimi, the officer to guard the City of Yamato (the old capital in Asuka) while the master was away, to raise an army.

sen.j: このとき稚狭王も倭京にあってその仕事に携わっていたらしい。
sen.e: It was said Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato when the war broke out and that he was also charged with forming military troops for Prince Otomo.
It was said that Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato when the war broke out, and that he was also involved with forming the military troops for the Prince Otomo.
sen.cmt: that, the, カンマを補いました。charged→involved と修正しました。
sen.e: It was said that Wakasa no Okimi was in the City of Yamato when the war broke out, and that he was also involved with forming the military troops for the Prince Otomo.

sen.j: しかし、大海人皇子にくみした大伴吹負は、少数で乗り込んで敵軍の指揮権を奪取する計略を立てた。
sen.e: In the meantime, OTOMO no Fukei who was on the side of Prince Oama planned to wrest control of the enemy's troops by breaking into the City of Yamato with a small number of soldiers.
In the meantime, OTOMO no Fukei who was on the side of the Prince Oama planned to seize the control of the enemy's troops by breaking into the City of Yamato with a small number of soldiers.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。wrest→seize と修正しました。
sen.e: In the meantime, OTOMO no Fukei who was on the side of the Prince Oama planned to seize the control of the enemy's troops by breaking into the City of Yamato with a small number of soldiers.

sen.j: 内応を得て軍を従わせた吹負は、穂積百足を殺し、穂積五百枝と物部日向を捕らえた。
sen.e: By using traitors, Fukei successfully subdued the enemy troops and killed HOZUMI no Momotari and captured HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka.
By using traitors, Fukei successfully subdued the enemy troops and killed HOZUMI no Momotari and captured HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka.
By using traitors, Fukei successfully subdued the enemy troops and killed HOZUMI no Momotari and captured HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka.

sen.j: 五百枝と日向は後に赦されて吹負の軍に加わった。
sen.e: Ioe and Himuka were later discharged and joined Fukei's army.
Ioe and Himuka were later forgiven and joined Fukei's army.
Ioe and Himuka were later forgiven and joined Fukei's army.

sen.j: 高坂王と稚狭王も軍に従った。
sen.e: Takasaka no Okimi and Wakasa no Okimi also joined Fukei's army.
Takasaka no Okimi and Wakasa no Okimi also joined Fukei's army.
Takasaka no Okimi and Wakasa no Okimi also joined Fukei's army.

sen.j: 天武天皇7年（678年）9月に、三位で亡くなった。
sen.e: Wakasa no Okimi died in September 678, when he was in a position of Sanmi (Third Rank.)
Wakasa no Okimi died in September 678, when he was in a position of Sanmi (Third Rank).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Wakasa no Okimi died in September 678, when he was in a position of Sanmi (Third Rank).
